lesson.title: Asynchronous Event Processing
lesson.summary: Event-driven architecture uses events to trigger and communicate between loosely coupled services, enabling reactive and scalable systems.
lesson.real_world_example: LinkedIn's Kafka-based event streaming platform processes over 7 trillion messages per day for real-time analytics and recommendations
